item.description: Both likelihood-based methods and GAN methods have have some intrinsic limitations. Learning and estimating Stein score (the gradient of the log-density function) may be a better choice than learning the data density directly. Score Estimation (for training) We want to train a network $s_{\theta}(x)$ to estimate $\nabla_{ x} \log p_{\text {data }}( x)$, but how can we get the ground truth (real score)? In this paper, the objective $\frac{1}{2} E_{p_{\text{data}}} \lbrack\lVert s_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}( x)-\nabla_{ x} \log p_{\text{data}}( x)\rVert_2^2\rbrack$ is equivalent to the following by Score Matching:
